meanings.definition: A photograph or image taken with a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The scientist examined the tiny cells under the microscope and captured a detailed micrograph.
meanings.sent2: I saw a fascinating micrograph of a butterfly wing magnified a thousand times.
meanings.sent3: The artist's micrograph of the ant's world made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a vivid micrograph, capturing every detail of that moment.
meanings.sent5: The micrograph revealed a hidden world of intricate patterns and structures.

meanings.sent1: The textbook included a helpful micrograph of the water cycle.
meanings.sent2: She sketched a quick micrograph of the proposed layout for the garden.
meanings.sent3: The micrograph of the cat wearing a top hat was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a micrograph of interconnected ideas, each one leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The micrograph simplified the complex process into an easy-to-understand visual.
